clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study of NeoRecormon (Epoetin Beta) in Cancer Patients With Anemia (FAST)
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmaco-epidemiological Observational Study of the Clinical Benefit of NeoRecormonÂ® in Cancer Patients With Anemia, According to Early Response to Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: This observational study will evaluate the clinical benefit of NeoRecormon (epoetin beta) in daily routine practice in cancer patients with anemia. Data will be collected from patients who are receiving chemotherapy for a solid tumor or hematological malignancy. Patients will be followed for 28 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Early Treatment Response: Day 28 to 42
primary_outcome.description: Early treatment response was defined as an increase of Hemoglobin (Hb) concentration of at least 1 gram/deciliter (g/dL), 4 to 6 weeks after treatment initiation.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Early Treatment Response: Day 21 to 42
primary_outcome.description: Early treatment response was defined as an increase of Hb concentration of at least 1 g/dL, 3 to 6 weeks after treatment initiation.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With At Least 1 Red Blood Cell (RBC) Transfusion
primary_outcome.description: Participants with at least 1 RBC transfusion was assessed based on the number of participants with early response or not at Day 21 to 42. Early treatment response was defined as an increase of Hb concentration of at least 1 g/dL, 3 to 6 weeks after treatment initiation.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of RBC Transfusions
primary_outcome.description: Mean number of transfusion was based on the number of participants with at least 1 RBC transfusion.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of RBC Units
primary_outcome.description: Mean number of units was based on the number of participants with at least 1 RBC transfusion.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to First RBC Transfusions
primary_outcome.description: Time to first RBC transfusion was assessed based on the number of participants with early response or not at Day 21 to 42. Early treatment response was defined as an increase of Hb concentration of at least 1 g/dL, 3 to 6 weeks after treatment initiation. Kaplan-Meier estimate was used.

primary_outcome.measure: Karnofsky Performance Status (KPS): Baseline
primary_outcome.description: KPS was used to quantify participant's general well-being and activities of daily life and participants were classified based on their functional impairment. An 11-level score, KPS score ranged between 0 (death) to 100 (no evidence of disease). Higher score means higher ability to perform daily tasks. KPS was based on the number of participants with early response.

primary_outcome.measure: KPS: Week 4 to 6
primary_outcome.description: KPS was used to quantify participant's general well-being and activities of daily life and participants were classified based on their functional impairment. An 11-level score, KPS score ranged between 0 (death) to 100 (no evidence of disease). Higher score means higher ability to perform daily tasks. KPS was based on the number of participants with early response.

primary_outcome.measure: KPS: Week 12 to 16
primary_outcome.description: KPS was used to quantify participant's general well-being and activities of daily life and participants were classified based on their functional impairment. An 11-level score, KPS score ranged between 0 (death) to 100 (no evidence of disease). Higher score means higher ability to perform daily tasks. KPS was based on the number of participants with early response.

primary_outcome.measure: KPS: Week 24 to 28
primary_outcome.description: KPS was used to quantify participant's general well-being and activities of daily life and participants were classified based on their functional impairment. An 11-level score, KPS score ranged between 0 (death) to 100 (no evidence of disease). Higher score means higher ability to perform daily tasks. KPS was based on the number of participants with early response.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Professional Activity: Baseline
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with professional activity was assessed based on the number of participants with early response or not at Day 21 to 42. Professional activity was categorized as active; disability; no occupation; retired; sick leave; student, training; and unemployment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With At Least 1 Sick Leave
primary_outcome.description: Sick leaves was described in active participants at inclusion (professional activity: active, in sick leave or unemployed participants).

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Days of Sick Leave
primary_outcome.description: Sick leaves was described in active participants at inclusion (professional activity: active, in sick leave or unemployed participants).

primary_outcome.measure: Self-Reported Questionnaire: Percentage of Participants With Current Employment at Baseline
primary_outcome.description: Self-administered questionnaire, work productivity and activity impairment (WPAI) questionnaire was used to assess work and activity impairment due to anemia in cancer participants in the last 7 days. The self-administered questionnaire consisted of 6 questions. It assessed amount of absenteeism, presenteeism and daily activity impairment attributable to anemia in cancer participants. Question 1 asked participants to indicate if they were currently employed or working for pay (Yes or No). Data reported for the outcome included those who were employed.

primary_outcome.measure: Self-Reported Questionnaire: Percentage of Participants With Current Employment at Week 4 to 6
primary_outcome.description: Self-administered questionnaire, WPAI questionnaire was used to assess work and activity impairment due to anemia in cancer participants in the last 7 days. The self-administered questionnaire consisted of 6 questions. It assessed amount of absenteeism, presenteeism and daily activity impairment attributable to anemia in cancer participants. Question 1 asked participants to indicate if they were currently employed or working for pay (Yes or No). Data reported for the outcome included those who were employed.

primary_outcome.measure: Self-Reported Questionnaire: Percentage of Participants With Current Employment at Week 12 to 16
primary_outcome.description: Self-administered questionnaire, WPAI questionnaire was used to assess work and activity impairment due to anemia in cancer participants in the last 7 days. The self-administered questionnaire consisted of 6 questions. It assessed amount of absenteeism, presenteeism and daily activity impairment attributable to anemia in cancer participants. Question 1 asked participants to indicate if they were currently employed or working for pay (Yes or No). Data reported for the outcome included those who were employed.

primary_outcome.measure: Self-Reported Questionnaire: Percentage of Participants With Current Employment at Week 24 to 28
primary_outcome.description: Self-administered questionnaire, WPAI questionnaire was used to assess work and activity impairment due to anemia in cancer participants in the last 7 days. The self-administered questionnaire consisted of 6 questions. It assessed amount of absenteeism, presenteeism and daily activity impairment attributable to anemia in cancer participants. Question 1 asked participants to indicate if they were currently employed or working for pay (Yes or No). Data reported for the outcome included those who were employed.

primary_outcome.measure: Self-Reported Questionnaire: Change From Baseline on the Impact of Health on Regular Activities at Week 4 to 6
primary_outcome.description: Self-administered questionnaire, WPAI questionnaire was used to assess work and activity impairment due to anemia in cancer participants in the last 7 days. The self-administered questionnaire consisted of 6 questions. It assessed amount of absenteeism, presenteeism and daily activity impairment attributable to anemia in cancer participants. Question 6 asked participants to indicate how much their anemia affected their ability to do their regular daily activities such as housework, childcare, exercising, shopping, studying and so on, in the past 7 days on a scale from 0 (no effect) to 10 (completely prevented from doing daily activities).

primary_outcome.measure: Self-Reported Questionnaire: Change From Baseline on the Impact of Health on Regular Activities at Week 12 to 16
primary_outcome.description: Self-administered questionnaire, WPAI questionnaire was used to assess work and activity impairment due to anemia in cancer participants in the last 7 days. The self-administered questionnaire consisted of 6 questions. It assessed amount of absenteeism, presenteeism and daily activity impairment attributable to anemia in cancer participants. Question 6 asked participants to indicate how much their anemia affected their ability to do their regular daily activities such as housework, childcare, exercising, shopping, studying and so on, in the past 7 days on a scale from 0 (no effect) to 10 (completely prevented from doing daily activities).

primary_outcome.measure: Self-Reported Questionnaire: Change From Baseline on the Impact of Health on Regular Activities at Week 24 to 28
primary_outcome.description: Self-administered questionnaire, WPAI questionnaire was used to assess work and activity impairment due to anemia in cancer participants in the last 7 days. The self-administered questionnaire consisted of 6 questions. It assessed amount of absenteeism, presenteeism and daily activity impairment attributable to anemia in cancer participants. Question 6 asked participants to indicate how much their anemia affected their ability to do their regular daily activities such as housework, childcare, exercising, shopping, studying and so on, in the past 7 days on a scale from 0 (no effect) to 10 (completely prevented from doing daily activities).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Starting Dose of NeoRecormonÂ® Injection
secondary_outcome.description: Dose of NeoRecormonÂ® injection was measured in international units/kilograms/weeks (IU/kg/weeks).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Starting Dose Between 360 and 540 IU/kg/Weeks
Percentage of Participants With Pre-specified Dose and Frequency of Injections
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4 to 6, Week 12 to 16, Week 24 to 48
secondary_outcome.description: Pre-specified doses and frequency included; 20000 IU/week - Once a week (qw), 30000 IU/week -qw, 30000 IU/week - Twice a week (tw), 30000 IU/week - Once every 2 weeks (q2w), 40000 IU/week - qw, 60000 IU/week - qw, and other. Missing data were not reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Subcutaneous (SC) Route of Administration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4 to 6, Week 12 to 16, Week 24 to 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With NeoRecormonÂ® SC Injections at a Weekly Dose of 30000 IU
Percentage of Participants With Modifications of NeoRecormonÂ® Regimen
secondary_outcome.description: All modifications were based on the change in frequency, route of administration or dose depending on the need for treatment adjustments according to Hb concentration. Percentage of participants with at least 1 modification in NeoRecormonÂ® regimen was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Temporary Discontinuation From NeoRecormonÂ® Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with at least 1 temporary discontinuation was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Permanent Discontinuation From NeoRecormonÂ® Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Week 4 to 6, Week 12 to 16, Week 24 to 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative Percent Change in Hb Concentration From Baseline Over the Study Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4 to 6, Week 12 to 16, Week 24 to 28

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hb Concentration Within the Range of 10 to 12 g/dL
Percentage of Participants With Adequate Iron Status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 4 to 6, Week 12 to 16, Week 24 to 48
secondary_outcome.description: Criteria for adequate iron status included serum ferritin greater than (>) 100 micrograms/liter (Âµg/L) and transferrin saturation (TSAT)> 20%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Vitamins Prescription
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 4 to 6, Week 12 to 16, Week 24 to 48

study_pop.textblock: Anemic cancer patients receiving NeoRecormon (epoetin beta)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, >/=18 years of age
- Patients receiving myelosuppressive chemotherapy for a solid tumor, a hematological malignancy or an autograft for hematological malignancy
- Patients for whom treatment with epoetin beta is started at the inclusion visit
- Life expectancy >/=6 months according to the physician
- Patients accepting and able to complete a French written questionnaire about his/her professional and social activities at each visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who received erythropoiesis-stimulating agents treatment, or red blood cell transfusion within 4 weeks before enrollment
- Participation in a clinical trial in onco-hematology
- Patients with myelodysplasia
- Patients with more than one active malignancy at the time of enrollment

outcome.title: Self-Reported Questionnaire: Change From Baseline on the Impact of Health on Regular Activities at Week 4 to 6
outcome.description: Self-administered questionnaire, WPAI questionnaire was used to assess work and activity impairment due to anemia in cancer participants in the last 7 days. The self-administered questionnaire consisted of 6 questions. It assessed amount of absenteeism, presenteeism and daily activity impairment attributable to anemia in cancer participants. Question 6 asked participants to indicate how much their anemia affected their ability to do their regular daily activities such as housework, childcare, exercising, shopping, studying and so on, in the past 7 days on a scale from 0 (no effect) to 10 (completely prevented from doing daily activities).
